pull.title: test, build: Separate `read_json` function into its own module
pull.body:
Currently, 4 source files rely on the definition of the `read_json` function provided in `src/test/script_tests.cpp`.

This PR breaks this entanglement, improves code structure and maintainability.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26940](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26940) (test: Move rand utils from setup_common to random and add a helper by jonatack)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Rebased aa326abcfc63d842e77feb5e3cffc19926369416 -> 3394ad21b5a7e8ddfcc817e2eee996fb4b0bd4c6 ([pr25974.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25974.02) -> [pr25974.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25974.03)) due to the conflict with #26286.

author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1674811589 +0000

test, build: Separate `read_json` function into its own module

events.message: test, build: Separate `read_json` function into its own module

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2022 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <test/util/json.h>
+
+#include <boost/test/unit_test.hpp>
+#include <string>
+
+#include <univalue.h>
+
+UniValue read_json(const std::string& jsondata)
+{
+    UniValue v;
+    if (!v.read(jsondata) || !v.isArray()) {
+        BOOST_ERROR("Parse error.");
comments.body: In theory it is not allowed to link boosttest to libtest_util, but given that CI didn't fail, `BOOST_ERROR` is probably header-only?

@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@

+    if (!v.read(jsondata) || !v.isArray()) {
+        BOOST_ERROR("Parse error.");
comments.body: Ah ok. I think I have a slight preference to keep boost out of libtest_util, and thus out of the fuzz tests

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@

+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.

+UniValue read_json(const std::string& jsondata)
+{

+        BOOST_ERROR("Parse error.");
comments.body: Might be better to use `Assert` in any case to avoid the dead, confusing and dangerous return? (Dangerous because it returns an empty array, potentially running no tests at all)
